result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: JA review of 10/21/22 RUMS
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/10/24/22)
Arraignment on November 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
JA's review of 09/20 minutes
Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (09/20) ML
Arraignment on October 21, 2022 at 08:45 am.

2:35 PM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
ADA Shock appears on behalf of the State. 
22CF44 - Defendant Feliciano B Balboa appeared by phone.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court for Feliciano B Balboa. 
Cases 21CF490, 21CF618, 22CF19, 22CF41, 22CF222 and 22CT252 - Defendant Robert J. Meunier appears in person with Atty. Raff.
Court finds the phone connection to be sufficient for this hearing as it relates to Defendant Balboa.  

Court reviews cases history, status and filings relating to appointment of counsel for these Defendants. 
Court indicates that its appointment of Atty. Fischer for Mr. Balboa is a direct appointment.  
Court verifies that Atty. Raff is SPD appointed in all of these cases for Defendant Meunier. 

Court addresses scheduling in cases 22CF44 and 22CF41.  These two cases are continued for STC on 10/21/22 at 8:45am. Recess in these two cases at 2:44pm. 

CASE 21CF618 ONLY:
State requests that the Court take Judicial Notice of the Bond in 21CF490.  The Court takes Judicial Notice. 

Officer J. Peters sworn and testifies:
-  Direct examination by ADA Shock
-  Cross examination by Atty. Raff 
State rests. 
State moves for bind over. 
Court presents basis for findings and orders.  Court finds probable cause that the Defendant committed a felony.  Court binds the Defendant over for trial.

CASE 22CF222 ONLY:
State requests that the Court take Judicial Notice of the Bond in 22CF41, 22CF18, 21CF618 and 21CF490.  The Court takes Judicial Notice of the Bond in each case. 

Officer J. Higgins sworn and testifies:
-  Direct examination by ADA Shock
-  Cross examination by Atty. Raff 
State rests. 
State moves for bind over. 
Court presents basis for findings and orders.  Court finds probable cause that the Defendant committed a felony.  Court binds the Defendant over for trial.

All Meunier cases:
Scheduling addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
Cases continued for:
All cases - STC on 2:35 PM.  Clerk - CRHI. 
ADA Shock appears on behalf of the State. 
22CF44 - Defendant Feliciano B Balboa appeared by phone.  Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer in court for Feliciano B Balboa. 
Cases 21CF490, 21CF618, 22CF19, 22CF41, 22CF222 and 22CT252 - Defendant Robert J. Meunier appears in person with Atty. Raff.
Court finds the phone connection to be sufficient for this hearing as it relates to Defendant Balboa.

Court addresses scheduling in cases 22CF44 and 22CF41.  These two cases are continued for STC on 10/21/22 at 8:45am. Recess in these two cases at 2:44pm. 

CASE 21CF618 ONLY:
State requests that the Court take Judicial Notice of the Bond in 21CF490.  The Court takes Judicial Notice. 

Officer J. Peters sworn and testifies:

-  Cross examination by Atty. Raff 
State rests. 
State moves for bind over. 
Court presents basis for findings and orders.  Court finds probable cause that the Defendant committed a felony.  Court binds the Defendant over for trial.

Preliminary hearing on September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

[ml] Cases 21CF490, 21CF618, 22CF19, 22CF41, 22CF222, and 22CT252 called at 10:57AM
Defendant Robert J Meunier in court with Attorney Francis P Raff. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court and counsel discuss files 22CF19 and 22CF41 in relation to the cases involving co-defendants. Thereafter, Att Raff withdraws the Defense request for substitution of Judge in files 22CF41 and 22CF19, and requests that they be sent back to Branch 1.

Both parties advise that they are continuing to waive Preliminary Hearing time limits in files 22CF19 and 22CF41.

recess 11:07AM

NEXT: 
(1) Defense request for substitution of Judge has been withdrawn in file 22CF19 and 22CF41; Judicial transfer of these files are needed
(2) 22CF19 and 22CF41: Status Conference on 09/12 at 2:30PM with in person appearances (Branch 1) 
(3) 21CF618 and 22CF222: Preliminary Hearing on 09/09 at 8:30AM (files 21CF490 and 22CT252 to track along for Status)

Status conference on July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF19,22CF41,22CF222 called at 8:33am 
Defendant Robert J Meunier in court, in custody with Attorney Francis P Raff.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty Raff indicates that he will be requesting of SPD that all Mr. Meunier's open cases be assigned to him; and then submitting a request for substitution to allow all Mr. Meunier's cases to be heard before Branch III.
--no objection from ADA Teuber

recess: 8:40am 
NEXT: Status on 7/1/22 at 11:30am
Status conference on June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Atty. Raff with the same repayment order as previously ordered - The Court orders repayment at the rate of $80/month until the total sum is paid; beginning 7/1/2022 & payments shall be made to the Clerk of Courts by the 1st of every month thereafter.

[MK] cases #22CF19, #22CF41, #22CF222 called at 10:53am 
Defendant Robert J Meunier in court, in custody, with Attorney Karl Huebner. ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Huebner indicates that he has a conflict to serve as counsel; he previously represented a related party in one of the cases.  
The Court discharges Attorney Huebner as counsel. The Court directs the appointment of Attorney Frank Raff as counsel.  
recess 10:54am, reconvene 10:56am. 
Mr. Meunier re-raises his request for reduction of bond.  
Arguments are given by Mr. Meunier and by ADA Teuber. 
The Court denies the request for reduction of the required Cash Bond.  
recess10:58am 

NEXT:  (1) clerk- Attorney Huebner has been discharged as counsel, and the Court has directed that Attorney Raff is to be appointed as counsel,  (2) Status Conference (status of counsel) on June 2nd at 8:30am --JA note in comments that the cases are at prelim stage
Ec/pc: DA, Atty Huebner , Def (5/18/22--ma)

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
The Court orders repayment at the rate of $80/month until the total sum is paid; beginning 7/1/2022 & payments shall be made to the Clerk of Courts by the 1st of every month thereafter.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 24, 2022 at 10:45 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF19, 22CF41,22CF222 called at 11:13am 
Defendant Robert J Meunier appears in court, in custody.  Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the court record. 
The Court directs SPD to continue efforts to appoint counsel.

The Court direct Mr. Meunier to complete a petition for court appointed counsel for the Court's review. 
recess: 11:19am 
NEXT: Status on 5/24/22 at 10:45am
Status of Counsel
Copy of Incomplete Filing Letter re PFAC mailed to Defendant
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[MK] cases #22CF19, #22CF41, #22CF222 called at 3:02pm 
Defendant Robert Meunier appears in court, in custody. ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases #22CF19 and #22CF41 are scheduled for Preliminary Hearings today, and the State has two officer-witnesses present to testify. 
Right to counsel is reviewed. The Court notes that Public Defender appointment of counsel is pending. Mr. Meunier makes references to applying at "Legal Help" and getting contacts from area attorneys regarding representation. He believes he may find a private attorney to represent him. The Court directs the clerk to provide Mr. Meunier the petition for the appointment of counsel [clerk provides blank petition form to Mr. Meunier with the case numbers and caption filled in] and indicates to Mr. Meunier that he should complete and file the petition form. 

Mr. Meunier requests reduction of the Cash Bond required amount in Case #22CF222. He makes statements in support of his request. 
ADA Shock argues in opposition to Bond modification.  
The Court reduces the Case #22CF22 Cash Bond amount requirement from $500 to now be a $475 Cash Bond requirement. 
As to Cases #22CF19 and #22CF41 the Court finds good cause to extend preliminary hearing time limits. 
recess 3:14pm 

NEXT: Status Conference on May 17th at 11:00am (JA note in calendar comments that each case is at prelim stage; as to cases #22CF19 and #22CF41also note that the Defense has requested timely prelims, and that the Court found good cause on 5/5 to extend the time limit)
Amended Bond
Scheduling Order
Status conference on May 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
No Special Conditions

[ml] Case called at 1:22PM
Defendant Robert J Meunier appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (the PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient by counsel agreement. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Preliminary Hearing time limit is waived by both parties.

The Court requires a $500.00 Cash Bond with no special conditions.

recess 1:29PM

NEXT: Status Conference (also Status of Counsel) on 05/05 at 3:00PM (to track along with the Defendant's other files)
